issue.title: doc, rpc: -rpcclienttimeout help string is wrong
issue.body:
```
$ bitcoin-cli --help   
Bitcoin Core RPC client version v0.19.0rc1
...
  -rpcclienttimeout=<n>
       Timeout in seconds during HTTP requests, or 0 for no timeout. (default:
       900)
```

The _"0 for no timeout"_ part, added in #9903, is wrong:

```
$ time bitcoin-cli -rpcclienttimeout=0 gettxoutsetinfo
error: Could not connect to the server 127.0.0.1:8332 (error code 0 - "timeout reached")

Make sure the bitcoind server is running and that you are connecting to the correct RPC port.

real	0m51.279s
user	0m0.005s
sys	0m0.019s
```

Both 0.18.0 and 0.19.0rc1 are affected.

issue.title: rpc: fix -rpcclienttimeout 0 option
issue.body:
fixes #17117

I understood the bug as the help string being wrong, rather than that this feature is missing and should be added. Let me know if it should be the other way around.

It is notable that if 0 is given as an argument, the fallback that is being used is the libevent default of 50 seconds, rather than `DEFAULT_HTTP_CLIENT_TIMEOUT` (900 seconds). This is not intuitive for the user. I could handle this in this PR but I am unsure which would be the better solution then: Actually adding the feature as described in the help string or falling back to `DEFAULT_HTTP_CLIENT_TIMEOUT`? Happy to hear opinions.

issue.title: error: Could not connect to the server 127.0.0.1:8332 (error code 0 - "timeout reached")
issue.body:
I am getting the following error message when trying to run the command `bitcoin-cli gettxoutsetinfo`:  

`error: Could not connect to the server 127.0.0.1:8332 (error code 0 - "timeout reached")` 
`Make sure the bitcoind server is running and that you are connecting to the correct RPC port.`

Other commands with bitcoin-cli seem to run fine.  

Googling the error message, I found this piece of info: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/17117#issuecomment-579736563. 

So perhaps "applying rpcclienttimeout=0 to the bitcoin-cli binary" might help here, but how would I go about that? I tried it with `bitcoin-cli -rpcclienttimeout=0 gettxoutsetinfo` but that didn't help. 

Or any other ideas I might try to fix it?  

Btw here is my current bitcoin.conf file, in case that's important. I tried adding `rpcclienttimeout=0` there as well, even if it doesn't seem like the right thing to do:
